Participants will learn basics of machine learning models and how to build a model for sturctured data.

session.title: Google Architecture Diagramming tool and new features
session.description:
Walkthrough of Google’s new Architecture diagramming tool, it’s features 
Demo on Automated infra provisioning using Architecture Diagramming tool with just few clicks - google has done all the hard work of writing and integrating terraform modules and iac with Architecture tool so anyone can just build a architecture n on click on button the stack gets provisioned on google cloud project. 
Apart from this, if time permits, some cool new features recently announced by google on pub/sub, BigQuery etc...

session.title: Working with Streaming Data on Google Cloud
session.description:
Customers expect businesses to respond faster and faster - in near real time.  Therefore applications involving continuous/streaming data analysis are a growing requirement.  In this session we will understand key concepts regarding streaming data and how to implement it on Google Cloud.

We will discuss the differences between batch data and streaming data and why older technologies do not work with streaming data.  Then we'll see what are windows, watermarks, and triggers.  Finally, we will see how to use Apache Beam and Google Cloud Dataflow to implement streaming systems.

session.title: Let’s Design a high availability ML heavy Cloud solution architecture
session.description:
We love the words Machine Learning and Cloud. They almost go together when we talk about ML research, development and deployment. However, more often than not, your models may perform slow or your system faces downtimes and model degradation a lot. How do you ensure that your ML pipeline doesn’t face downtimes and become a bottleneck in the growth of your business?

At Dynopii, we work with real-time deep learning-based models for our products and services that run 24x7. One of the first challenges we solved was to keep our models running with 0 downtimes despite multiple updates to it every day. I’ll be talking about how to analyze your ML pipeline and how to design an ML Cloud solution architecture that keeps your critical business processes running smoothly through both planned and unplanned outages.

This session will be agnostic to cloud service providers!

session.title: API Development Best Practices for a Cloud Native Future
session.description:
The benefits of moving to cloud native architectures often shadow its costs in security, scalability, complexity, and monitoring.

As monoliths become microservices, direct client-to-APIs communication means exposing the APIs for each microservice. This means that the API developers need to add functionalities like authentication, rate limiting, traffic control, and monitoring to each microservice.

Moreover, making changes to the API, like splitting or combining services, puts a burden on the consumers, requiring them to update their client applications.

An alternative is to adopt an API gateway to sit between your client and your microservices.

In this talk, Navendu walks through API development best practices and how API gateways simplify API development. He walks through how API developers can ensure security, deliver scalability, improve monitoring and analytics, and streamline development while building APIs for the evolving cloud.

session.title: Discovering Data Values using Google Cloud Platform
session.description: Data is backbone of any enterprise business now a day and an important assets. Google who is pioneer in Artificial Intelligence/Machine learning and Data Analytics invested a lot to bring these innovation as form of Google Cloud Platform. Google Cloud Platform consists of multiple data services which help business to generate the value and tangible insights. With this session, we would be covering some of those advance analytics use cases/stories which made significant impact into the business growth.

session.title: Unlock Graph Databases with GCloud and Neo4J
session.description:
Graph Database technology adoption is currently growing at an exponential rate. Gartner predicts 80 per cent of data and analytics innovations will use Graph Database technologies in 2025.

This session guides you through the core concepts of what makes Graph Databases so powerful. Learn about graph modelling and how it compares to traditional approaches. The session will discuss the quintessential use cases, such as fraud detection and knowledge graphs, so that you can get a feel for the technology.

Familiarize yourself with Neo4J, the most extensive Graph Database platform, and Google Cloud with a frictionless setup to instantly start with the technology.

session.title: Scaling up products with Cloud
session.description:
All of us know the paradigm shift from on-premises software to the cloud. This is already impacting the software industry and we can see its impact. But, how this affects the quality of product which is getting developed is something interesting to explore!
Continuous delivery, cross-functional collaboration, innovation, the gathering of requirements, and customer relationships are some areas which are changing with the integration of the cloud. As it offers greater flexibility and faster speed of delivery the quality automatically gets improved and we can see the impact on end consumers easily!
This talk will shed light on how traditional product management activities can become more dynamic in the cloud context!

session.title: Do the Right thing, shift Left!
session.description:
We all remember the famous phrase of Andreessen Horowitz, “Software is Eating the world”. It was definitely true at the time, but times have changed. It’s APIs that are now eating the world. Using APIs to expose core business functionality and facilitate service-to-service communication has become standard. Not only does it give us several control points but also makes it easier to deal with complex modern applications. Although these modern API-driven applications come with significant benefits in delivery speed and scalability, they also have issues like design complexity, visibility, communication, and the most important one, API security. 

It is becoming increasingly urgent as API-related attacks are impacting companies across nearly all sectors, resulting in skyrocketing costs for businesses. In the U.S. alone, the average annual API-related cyber loss is estimated to be USD $12-23 billion. 

One of the best ways to deal with this is to make API security a part of your SDLC. API Security testing is one of the ways to do that. API security testing helps in finding vulnerabilities in very early stages, giving developers and Product security engineers more time and context to build resilient systems. 

In this talk, we intend to explain the rationale behind integrating API security testing into your Development life cycle to build secure applications and APIs using various OSS and Enterprise tools. We will also discuss some real-world scenarios which will help you solve the ultimate debate on Delivery v/s Security and solve for cascading impacts, ever so common in today’s world of distributed systems.

session.title: Data Platforms on Google Cloud
session.description: This session would talk about journey of data from raw data to monetization. How Google Cloud with its services could enable this journey. Session would talk about approached to build Data Platforms , Data consumption and Data Sharing.  Talk about architecture principles, pipeline patterns. How to approach deployment (DevOps, IaC), monitoring & observability; why these are important aspects for data platform. How to leverage data platform to build an integrated approach to Analytics ( Dashboards, Visualizations etc.)  & AI/ML.

session.title: ElasticRun - Data driven deep reach Kirana platform
Remote Config for App Personalisation
session.description:
Nowadays there is an app for everything and more importantly, Users are accustomed to the use of applications. No matter what you want there is an app for it. Retaining uses can be difficult in this situation. 

This is where personalised app experience might help in user retention. So when the user is using the app, the data is collected and accordingly the app can be personalised based on data analysis. 

But this can be a tedious process to launch a new update, where you have to go through app development, testing, deployment, submission, approval and then releases. 

Until a lot of damage had been already done, and many users have already left the application. 

Not anymore. With firebase remote config you can change the app behaviour and add app personalization on the GO. Directly through the cloud. And it will be available to all the users immediately. 

With remote config and AB testing, we can also test if the new feature is liked by the user or not.

Must say firebase remote config is a boon.
